titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George F. Johnston Company Records WA MSS S-2606
titlestmt.author: by Jennifer Meehan and Leigh Golden

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

note.p: This finding aid, which is compliant with the Yale EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0., has a MARC record in Yale's ILS with the following bib number: 8528132.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-06-06 19:33:42 UTC.

change.item: Transformed with yale.addEadidUrl.xsl. Adds @url with handle for finding aid. Overwrites @url if already present.

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
The collection consists of records documenting the day-to-day administration and operation of the George F. Johnston Company of Etiwanda, California. The records date from 1901 to 1954, with the bulk dating from 1901 to 1933, and relate to the company's production, sale, and distribution of grapes, its finances, and its labor force, which was primarily Japanese American. Included are correspondence, invoices, statements, sales and expense receipts, shipping logs and manifests, claims records, ledgers, daily time reports and time books, bank documents, and related material.
The collection provides documentation of the fruit trade and grape industry in California in the first half of the twentieth century, and sheds light on the work and experiences of fruit growers, viticulturists (grape growers), agricultural laborers, and vineyard laborers (grape pickers) in California during the same period.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Charles Apfelbaum on the William Robertson Coe Fund, 2007.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The George F. Johnston Company Records is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George F. Johnston Company Records. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection received a basic level of processing in 2007-2008. The material arrived at the library in a highly disorganized and dirty state; basic processing included rehousing all material into acid-free folders and boxes, surface cleaning of documents, and organization into files and series. Researchers should note that some material in the collection is still fairly dirty even after rehousing and surface cleaning.

bioghist.head: George F. Johnston Company
bioghist.p: The George F. Johnston Company was a grape growing and distributing company that operated in Etiwanda, California during the first half of the twentieth century--from circa 1905 to 1934 or later--and which supplied table grapes to many parts of the United States. The company was run by George F. Johnston. His sons, J. Spencer Johnston and Philip Johnston, also appear to have played a role in the company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of records documenting the day-to-day administration and operation of the George F. Johnston Company of Etiwanda, California. The records date from 1901 to 1954, with the bulk dating from 1901 to 1933, and relate to the company's production, sale, and distribution of grapes, its finances, and its labor force, which was primarily Japanese American. Included are correspondence, invoices, statements, sales and expense receipts, shipping logs and manifests, claims records, ledgers, daily time reports and time books, bank documents, and related material.

The collection provides documentation of the fruit trade and grape industry in California in the first half of the twentieth century, and sheds light on the work and experiences of fruit growers, viticulturists (grape growers), agricultural laborers, and vineyard laborers (grape pickers) in California during the same period.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into five series: I. Alphabetical Files, 1912-1933. II. Other General Business Records, 1901-1954. III. Other Sales and Expense Records, 1911-1926. IV. Labor Records, 1915-1933. V. Bank Records, 1911-1950.

This organization represents an order imposed by library staff and is not meant to reflect how the records were organized by the company, but rather to provide access to material which was received by the library in a highly disorganized state. Records that lent themselves to alphabetical arrangement (ie. that could be attributed to a particular entity) were sorted into files by name. The decision to arrange this material alphabetically was based on the fact that small alphabetical groupings were found which seemed to suggest some level of alphabetical organization on the part of the creator. Other more format- or function-based records were organized into series by type.

Researchers should note that material in each series will often overlap with material found in other series, particularly amongst I. Alphabetical Files, II. Other General Business Records, and III. Other Sales and Expense Records. In order to locate all relevant or related material, researchers will likely need to consult each series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of material attributable to a particular entity, including produce, distribution, shipping, and supply companies with which the George F. Johnston Company did business and individuals who either worked for or did business with the company. Material includes correspondence, statements, invoices, receipts, manifests, shipping receipts, and other material relating to the administration and operation of the company and the sale and shipping of grapes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two subseries: Name Files and General Letter Files.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Related material can found in and .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of material relating to particular companies and of sufficient quantity to warrant being arranged into files or file groupings by the name of the company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically. Material within files has not been arranged in any particular order.

did.unittitle: California Pine Box Distributors (formerly California Pine Box & Lumber Co.)
Sun Maid Raisin Growers (formerly California Associated Raisin Company)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of material relating to particular companies and individuals arranged into general files by first letter of the company name or the individual's surname. In certain instances, Johnston would begin conducting correspondence with a company and would later carry on correspondence with an individual from the company. Researchers will likely need to look under both company and individual name to locate all related material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically. Material within files has not been arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of material relating in general to the administration and operation of the George F. Johnston Company. Found here are shipping records including shipping logs and claims records; account records including ledgers; tax records; foreman reports; notebooks; and correspondence. Other materials, which document aspects of the grape industry in general, are a fruit and produce code book dating from 1918 and an undated photograph of Japanese laborers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are largely arranged in chronological order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Related material can be found in and .

did.physloc: See: Form, Car Manifest (from Series II)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of receipts, statements, and other material relating to grape sales and operation expenses of the George F. Johnston Company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged by type in chronological order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Related material can be found in and .

did.unittitle: Grape Receipts / Certificates of Weight and Measure

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of daily time reports, statements, and time books for day laborers, many of Japanese descent, who worked picking grapes for the George F. Johnston Company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are largely arranged in chronological order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Related material can be found filed under the name of individuals in .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of returned checks, deposit slips, and statements, as well as checkbooks and promissary notes relating to the banking activities of the George F. Johnston Company.
